pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.amadron: §0Increases the Amadron Tablet's air storage by by 2 * √U, where U = the number of Volume Upgrades, allowing the Amadron Tablet to run longer between recharges.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.armor.c: §0With one or more Charging Upgrades installed, your chestplate can automatically charge all other pressurizable items in your inventory, either worn or carried (note: will only charge items with a lower pressure than the chestplate).

§0With one or more Dispenser Upgrades installed, you gain the ability to launch items and blocks from your offhand slot by pressing and releasing the launch key (Control + C by default).

• Some items and blocks are handled specially, deploying the item/block as an entity, similar to the way a Dispenser would operate.
• Items which don't have special handling will simply be launched as item entities.
• Blocks which don't have special handling will be launched as "tumbling block" entities, which will try to reform as blocks on impact with any other block.

Up to four Dispenser Upgrades can be installed for greater launch distances.

§0Allows Elytra gliding, just as if you were wearing a vanilla Elytra. No durability damage is taken, in return for a minor air cost while actively gliding.

Works well in conjunction with Jet Boots and the Smart Hover mode!

§0With a Magnet Upgrade installed, your chestplate can automatically pull nearby items toward you for a small air cost. The base range is 4 blocks; each upgrade installed extends the range by one block.
§0With a Range Upgrade installed in your chestplate, your reach distance (not including melee attacks) is increased by 4 blocks. This comes with a small ongoing air cost.

§0With a Security Upgrade installed, you will gain protection from fire and lava at a significant air cost: air will be rapidly dumped from the chestplate to extinguish nearby flames and solidify nearby lava.
Note: this protection activates if you are about to take fire damage, so if you are already protected (e.g. via a potion), this upgrade won't do anything.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.armor.f:
§0With a Dispenser Upgrade installed in your boots, you can kick entities in front of you at a modest air cost.  Kicked entities will take moderate damage and heavy knockback. More upgrades will increase damage & knockback, but also increase air usage.

This works on non-living entities too...

§0With a Flippers Upgrade installed in your boots, you will benefit from a slightly improved swim speed. This has no extra air cost, and is a much cheaper alternative to using the Jet Boots underwater.

§0With a Jet Boots Upgrade installed in your boots, you gain limited flying ability for a significant air cost.  When the upgrade is enabled, holding the Jump key (Space by default) will propel you in the direction you're looking.  When Jump is not held, you will slowly and safely descend to the ground (hold Sneak for faster descent).
5 tiers of upgrade are available for faster flight (and - of course - greater air usage). At tier 3 or better, you can also toggle Builder Mode via the armor GUI, which provides for more creative-style flight with faster in-air block breaking, but at a reduced movement speed. Tier 5 also allows you to hover in-place with no descent.
The Jet Boots will also function underwater, but at a much higher air cost.
§0The Stomp upgrade, when active, will damage nearby monsters if you drop on them from a great height. The damage done (and air consumed) is proportional to how fast you hit the ground.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.armor.g: §0Air Conditioning Upgrades help to regulate your body temperature for a moderate air cost. Each armor piece will help to cool or warm you as necessary to maintain a comfortable body temperature. This is most effective with Air Conditioning Upgrades installed in all pieces, but every little helps.

§0Armor Upgrades add a small amount of armor protection to the armor piece.  2 upgrades will bring the armor level up to Diamond Armor level; the maximum number of upgrades offers excellent protection.
§0A Creative Upgrade in any armor piece negates all armor damage and air usage for that piece, unconditionally.
§0A Gilded Upgrade in any armor piece is equivalent to wearing a piece of Gold Armor, as far as Piglins are concerned.
§0Item Life Upgrades allow this armor piece to be slowly auto-repaired, at a cost of air.  More upgrades mean faster repair (but progressively more inefficient air usage).

§0Protects against radiation damage from other mods, such as Mekanism. For full protection, you need one Radiation Shielding Upgrade in every piece of armor, although any upgrades are better than none at all.
§0Each Speed Upgrade installed reduces this armor piece's startup time.
§0With a Thaumcraft Upgrade installed, you get a Vis discount equivalent to the corresponding Thaumaturge's Armor piece.
§0Each Volume Upgrade installed increases this armor piece's air storage capacity by 2 * √U (e.g x2 for 1 upgrade, x4 for 4 upgrades...), allowing it to operate longer between recharges.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.armor.h: §0With the Block Tracker you'll be able to track Chests, Mob Spawners, Furnaces, Silverfish Blocks, Tripwires, Dispensers, TNT and End Portal Blocks within a range of 30 blocks. This way Dungeons, Fortresses and temples can easily be found. Inventories can even be remotely examined, as hovering over one of these indicators will show their inventories.

§0The Coordinate Tracker upgrade allows you to track one specific coordinate, which can be used for example when you are tunneling to a certain location, without knowing the exact place this location is at in relation to where you are at that moment. Meant for people that don't like to use F3. As second feature this upgrade will use Minecraft's entity pathfinding to navigate you to wherever you want.

§0When used in conjunction with the Entity Tracker upgrade, the Dispenser Upgrade allows debugging & monitoring of active drones; target a drone and use the drone-debug hotkey (default: Y), then open the helmet options GUI (default: U).

A redstone particle effect will also be displayed in any blocks that nearby (within 32 blocks) drones are interested in.

§0Activate this to make it safe to look at Endermen; they'll no longer be able to tell you're looking at them. Note: causes some visual interference, but it's better than sticking your head in a pumpkin...

§0With the Entity Tracker upgrade in, the helmet is able to track any living entity within a range of 16 blocks. These entities don't have to be visible, making this upgrade a perfect way to prevent Creepers sneaking up on you.
§0As its name suggests, the Night Vision upgrade allows you to see clearly in the dark, for a minor air cost.
§0Range Upgrades increase the range at which the Block and Entity Tracker Upgrades can operate.  Each upgrade increases the range by 5 blocks (but also increases air usage).
§0This upgrade allows you to breathe underwater, using air stored in your helmet. Note that this is less efficient in terms of air usage than an Aerial Interface, but also more... self-contained.

§0The Search Upgrade allows you to search for a specific item in (for example) your base. This upgrade depends on the Block Tracker, to be able to find the item existing in inventories, and on the Entity Tracker, which allows it to find the searched item when it lies on the ground. To experience the full effect of the upgrade you should install both these upgrades.

§0With one or more Security Upgrades installed, you gain the ability to §ohack§0 various blocks and entities in the world with the hacking hotkey (default: H).  Hacking has a variety of useful effects; try targeting things in the world with a Block and/or Entity Tracker Upgrade also installed.

§0With Speed Upgrades installed, the helmet will initialize its systems faster when equipped and lock onto blocks/entities faster (with the Block Tracker or Entity Upgrade installed, respectively).  Multiple Speed Upgrades can be installed to further reduce the initialization time, but air usage will increase.

§0With a Thaumcraft Upgrade installed, you gain the benefits of Goggles of Revealing: nodes are revealed, you get a 5%% Vis discount, and essentia levels of various containers are displayed on-screen.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.armor.l: §0With a Jumping Upgrade installed in your leggings, you will be able to jump higher.  4 tiers of this upgrade are available for progressively higher jumps (and higher air usage).  Holding Sneak while jumping will reduce the jump height to the equivalent of a single Jumping Upgrade.  Fall protection is included (no need to wear Pneumatic Boots).
§0With one or more Speed Upgrades installed in your leggings, you will be able to run faster. Extra upgrades increase the speed and air usage.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.collect: §0Increases the collection range of the the Drone by one block per upgrade.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.drone: §0Here you can insert upgrades into the Drone. Open up other tabs to see which enhancements can be done.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.drone.a:
§0Armor Upgrades give the drone a little protection, reducing incoming physical damage. Each upgrade is worth one point of armor (so 15 upgrades is equivalent to a full suit of Iron armor).
Note that equipping more than 6 Armor Upgrades does carry a small movement penalty for the drone, so you need to balance protection vs. speed.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.drone.i:
§0By default the Drone can carry one stack of items. For every Inventory Upgrade inserted, the Drone gains an additional slot in its internal storage.

It will also increase the internal liquid tank by 16000mB per upgrade, and 100000RF storage per upgrade (if installed). It also increases the rate at which the Drone can transfer RF (transfer = max storage / 100).
§0With Item Life Upgrades inserted, the Drone will be able to auto-repair, at a small air cost. The more upgrades you insert, the faster the repair and the higher the air cost.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.drone.m: §0With the Magnet Upgrade inserted, the Drone will automatically pick up nearby items, if it has free inventory space. The base range is 2 blocks, increasing by 1 block per inserted upgrade.

§0When inserted, the Drone will have a minigun attached to it, allowing it to perform ranged attacks (up to 16 blocks from the target, but see Range Upgrades) when an Entity Attack piece is used. Gun Ammo is required to fire, which needs to be imported with an Inventory Import piece.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.drone.r: §0Increases the range of the ranged attacks of the Drone (requiring a Minigun Upgrade) by one block per upgrade.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.drone.s:
§0With one Security Upgrade inserted, the Drone can operate within fluids; with two upgrades, fluids around the Drone will be temporarily displaced away; with three (or more) upgrades, fluids will be permanently removed.
The Drone will never willingly enter lava, regardless of Security Upgrades.

One or more Security Upgrades will also provide Drones with protection from electrical damage from uninsulated Immersive Engineering wiring; this also comes with an air cost, proportional to the damage negated.
§0For each Speed Upgrade inserted, the movement speed of the Drone is increased by 10%% of its base speed.
§0When inserted, the Drone will go into Standby mode when idle, saving air. Don't forget that Drones take fall damage, so care is advised.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.drone.v: §0For each Volume Upgrade inserted, the Drone's air storage capacity is increased by 2 * √U (e.g x2 for 1 upgrade, x4 for 4 upgrades...), allowing the Drone to run longer between recharges.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.jackham: §0A Magnet Upgrade will, when veinmining, cause all broken blocks to be dropped at the position of the block that was mined. This comes with a small extra air cost, but only when in a veinmining dig mode.
§0Increases the mining speed of the Jackhammer, with a corresponding increase in air usage. Adding more Speed Upgrades has diminishing returns.
§0Increases the Jackhammer's air storage by by 2 * √U, where U = the number of Volume Upgrades, allowing the Jackhammer to run longer between recharges.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.minigun: §0Each Dispenser Upgrade added increases the chance of ammo effects (potions, explosive, freezing etc.) being activated. This can significantly increase air usage, depending on the ammo type in use.
§0Zooms the player view when the minigun is activated. This has no extra air cost.

§0Slowly replenishes any ammo in the minigun's magazine, but at a steep air cost. Also prevents empty ammo cartridges from disappearing.
The Minigun must be on your hotbar for ammo to be replenished.
§0Increases the minigun's range. Each upgrade adds 5 meters to the base range of 50 meters. Increased range comes at an increased air cost.
§0Prevents the minigun from damaging tamed entities and other players. This has no extra air cost.
§0Allows the minigun to spin up faster, reducing delay before firing, and also adds a small chance of firing multiple rounds at once. This incurs a significantly increased air cost.
Increases the Minigun's air storage by by 2 * √U, where U = the number of Volume Upgrades, allowing the Minigun to run longer between recharges.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.item.pneumat: §0On its own these boots are slightly better than Iron Boots. However, you can install various upgrades here to unlock many useful extra features.  The Boots provide step assist functionality for free (no upgrade, no air cost); this can be disabled in the Pneumatic Armor GUI if you don't like step assist.  The boots also negate fall damage at a small air cost.
§0On its own this chestplate is slightly better than an Iron Chestplate. However, you can install various upgrades here to unlock many useful extra features.
§0On its own this helmet is slightly better than an Iron Helmet. However, you can install various upgrades here to unlock many useful extra features.
§0On its own these leggings are slightly better than Iron Leggings. However, you can install various upgrades here to unlock many useful extra features.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.items: Add plastic in the bottom slot. In this slot plastic also will be put when it cools down into plastic. Add dye in the top slot. Note that when mixing dye with plastic, dye has a much lower effect than mixing another color of Plastic.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.logistic_fra:
§0Active Provider frames can provide resources to Requester frames and Storage / Default Storage frames.

By default the framed inventory will provide every item in the inventory. By adding items to this filter, only items specified will be provided. Add items from your inventory or search for an item/fluid by right clicking an empty slot.

§0Default Storage frames can receive resources from Active Providers and supply resources to Requesters and Storage Frames. They have a lower priority than Storage frames, which will be always be used first if possible.

By default the framed inventory will accept any resources from providing inventories. By adding items to this filter, only items specified can be inserted via the logistics network. Add items from your inventory or search for an item/fluid by right clicking an empty slot.

§0Passive Provider frames can provide resources to Requester Frames.

By default the framed inventory will provide every item in the inventory. By adding items to this filter, only those items will be provided. Add items from your inventory, or search for an item/fluid by right clicking an empty slot.

§0Requester frames can request resources from any other framed inventory.

Here you can specify the resources and quantities that Logistics Drones / Logistics Modules should keep stocked in the framed inventory. Either insert items from your inventory, or search for an item/fluid by right clicking an empty slot.

§0Storage frames can receive resources from Active Providers and supply resources to Requesters.

By default the framed inventory accepts any item from providing inventories. By adding items to this filter, only items specified can be inserted via the logistics network. Add items from your inventory or search for an item/fluid by right clicking an empty slot.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.logisticsReq: When checked, Logistics Drones will inform the AE2 Network about logistics-providable items (which then appear as 'craftable' items in AE2). When crafting is requested, AE2 will set up the Requester Frame to request the requested items.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.programmable: When checked, the Programmable Controller will automatically charge the "drone's" held item from its own buffers (pressure and/or Forge Energy), where appropriate.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.security_sta:
§0This is the Security Station hacking console. You, the hacker, start at the IO Port. From there, you can hack neighbouring Network Nodes by left-clicking on them; a node hack will begin, which takes some time, dependent on the size of the target node.
Every time you capture a node, you have a chance to be detected by the Diagnostic Subroutine, which will initiate a trace back to you at the IO Port.
You lose if the Subroutine traces the IO Port. If this is a live hack (not just a test), and the Diagnostic is awake, it will hurt. A lot.
You win when you've hacked the Diagnostic Subroutine or the Network Registry; the Security Station will then cease to protect its surrounding area until rebooted by its owner.

§0The Nuke Virus is a consumable item which can be used to insta-capture a Network Node or other component without any chance of being detected by the Diagnostic Subroutine. To use it, middle-click a hackable node which already has a hacked neighbor.
Note that there is a short cooldown on repeated uses of Nuke Viruses.

§0With a STOP! Worm, you can stop an active Diagnostic Subroutine from tracing you for about 5 seconds, give or take a second or so. This software will be used in the process. To use it click on the STOP! Worm button, after you have been detected.
§eAlt + Left-Click
§f• Empty slot: mark slot (and all following slots) closed
• Empty closed or filtered slot: remove filter
• Item in slot or on cursor: filter on that item
• Also hold Shift to set item limit to max

§eAlt + Mouse Wheel
§f• Filtered slot: adjust item limit
• Also hold Shift for fast adjust

§eAlt + Cursor Up/Down
§f• Adjust item limit, like Alt + Mouse Wheel
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.info.tubeModule: §0In this interface you can define exactly how a module should behave, dependent on the redstone signal. The signal will be proportional to the pressure interpolated between the lower and higher bounds.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.minigun.slotInfo:
The Minigun will normally draw ammo from the lowest-numbered slot which contains any ammo.

§aMiddle-click§f a slot to lock that slot: when locked, the Minigun will draw ammo from that slot only. §aMiddle-click§f a locked slot to unlock it.

Locking slots is useful if you're carrying multiple ammo types.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.omnidirectionalHo: Leave one item per slot, to filter.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.pneumaticDoorBase:
If checked, any redstone signal to this Door Base will also affect the connected Pneumatic Door, when in Wooden or Iron Door mode.
If not checked, the Pneumatic Door itself must receive a redstone signal to open.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.status.pressurize: Air Usage: %d mL per spawn attempt
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.advanced:
§fThe Compressor is running at a suboptimal efficiency. Efficiency: %s
§0Cool the machine down to under 50°C.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.solar_co:
§fThe compressor is running at a suboptimal efficiency.
Efficiency: %s

§0Heat the machine up to ~350°C to reach maximum efficiency, but don't let it exceed %s°C!
§fThe solar compressor is getting too hot! Don't let it exceed %s°C unless you like fire!
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.aerialIn:
§fNo player set!
§0Break and replace the machine to link it up.

§fPlayer %s is offline!
§0The Aerial Interface is non-functional until they return.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.air_cann:
§fNo Inventory Space
§0The last-fired item couldn't be inserted into the target inventory due to lack of space.

§fNo Coordinate Set
§0Insert a GPS Tool (with a coordinate set) into the GPS Slot. The GPS Tool can be removed once inserted.

§fNothing to Fire
§0Insert items into the cannon slot.

§fOut of Range
§0The selected coordinate is too far away. Add some Range Upgrades or select a closer coordinate.

§fStill Turning
§0Wait for the cannon to finish turning.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.airCompr:
§fNo fuel!
§0Insert any burnable item (not including buckets of lava or fuel).
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.airLeak:
§fAir leak!
§0Place pipes or machines on the output side(s).
§fMissing inventory or fluid tank.
§0Right-click an inventory and/or fluid tank with your Amadron Tablet.

§fOut of fluid to sell!
§0Your order has been capped. Add more fluid to the bound tank if needed.

§fNot enough space in destination tank.
§0Make sure no other fluid is in the bound tank and/or bind a larger tank.

§fOut of items to sell!
§0Your order has been capped. Add more items to the bound inventory if needed.

§fNot enough space in destination inventory.
§0Create space in the bound inventory.

§fOut of stock!
§0Come back later, maybe the vendor will resupply...

§fNot enough stock!
§0This is as much as you can order!

§fToo many items ordered!
§0An Amadrone can't carry more than 36 stacks of items. You will need to split your order into separate orders.

§fToo much fluid ordered!
§0An Amadrone can't carry more than 576 buckets of fluid. You will need to split your order into separate orders.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.assembly:
§fDuplicate Machine Detected!
§0Ensure there is only one %s.

§fMissing Machine!
§0Not all machines for the inserted program are present. Add one %s to your assembly system.

§fNo Program!
§0Insert an Assembly Program into the Controller.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.charging:
§fNo item to (dis)charge
§0Put any pneumatic item in the charge slot.

§f%s can't be (dis)charged
§0Item and Charging Station pressures have equalized.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.electros:
§fAir Redirection
§0When lightning strikes with a full air tank, not all the energy can be redirected! Connect up more Iron Bars to the underside of the Electrostatic Compressor.
Grounding: %d/%dmL
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.elevator:
§fFully Extended
§0Add (more) Elevator Frames on top of the elevator.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.etching_:
§fFailed Output Full
§0No further items can be etched until the failed output is cleared.

§fNo Etching Acid
§0Fill the tank with some Etching Acid.

§fOutput Full
§0No further items can be etched until the output is cleared.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.exposedF:
§fPoorly insulated
§0%d of %d block faces are exposed to the air, which wastes heat. Ensure no neighboring blocks are air blocks to insulate the machine for better performance.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.solar_co: §fBoth panels of the solar compressor must be fully exposed to the clear sky during the day.

§fThe solar compressor overheated! Didn't you notice the fire?!

§0Repair it by right clicking on it with a solar cell, and be more careful next time!
§fNot enough tank space to pump.
§0Connect up a tank.

§fNo Drill Pipes!
§0Place some Drill Pipes in the inventory.

§fNo space for Drill Pipes!
§0Remove excess Drill Pipes from the inventory.

§fDrill Pipes stuck!
§0Drill Pipes have encountered an unbreakable block, and can't dig any further down here.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.jackhamm:
§fDrill Bit Missing
§0Insert any Drill Bit into the drill bit slot (top right).
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.kerosene:
§fBad fluid in tank!
§0Pump out the fluid with a Liquid Hopper or other fluid extraction device.

§fLow on fuel.
§0Add Kerosene through a fluid insertion method (like a Liquid Hopper or Logistics Drone).

§fOut of fuel
§0Add Kerosene by placing a Kerosene Bucket in the slot, or through a fluid insertion method (like a Liquid Hopper or Logistics Drone).
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.liquidCo:
§fOut of fuel
§0Add any of the fuels listed in the 'Available Fuels' tab.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.missingI:
§fInsufficient ingredients
§0Resources in input are missing or don't match any known recipe for this machine.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.notEnoug:
§fNot enough fluid
§0Current recipe requires more input fluid than is present.

§fNot enough heat
§0Apply more heat by adding blocks that generate heat around this machine.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.outputBl:
§fOutput Blocked
§0Remove items and/or fluids from the machine's output.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.tooMuchH:
§fToo much heat
§0Remove some heat from this machine by adding cold blocks or conductive blocks around this machine.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.pressure:
§fНедостаточное давление
§0Apply more pressure to the Pressure Chamber. The required pressure is dependent on the number of items being transported.

§fBad Multiblock!
§0The Pressure Chamber Multiblock is not properly formed.

§fNo valid items in chamber
§0Insert valid items into the chamber to be compressed.

§fToo Much Pressure
§0Remove air from the chamber.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.pressuri:
§fNo Spawner Core
§0Insert a (non-empty) Spawner Core to spawn mobs from.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.programm:
§fNo program inserted
§0Insert a programmed Network API or Drone.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.provideR: §0Provide a redstone signal if you want the machine to run.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.refinery:
§fNo input fluid.
§0Pump fluid into the Refinery.

§fNot enough Refineries.
§0Refineries need to be stacked on top of each other, ranging from 2 to 4 Refineries.

§fNo output space for fluids.
§0Remove any output fluids.

§fToo many Refineries.
§0Refineries need to be stacked on top of each other, ranging from 2 to 4 Refineries.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.removeRe: §0Remove the redstone signal if you want the machine to run.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.sentryTu:
§fThe Sentry Turret has no ammo.
§0Add Gun Ammo to the Ammo slots.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.security: The Network Registry and Network IO Port must be connected. Use Network Nodes to connect them.
The Diagnostic Subroutine and Network IO Port must be connected. Use Network Nodes to connect them.
There must be exactly one Network IO Port.
There must be exactly one Network Registry.
There must be exactly one Diagnostic Subroutine.

§fStation Rebooting
The Security Station doesn't provide security until reboot is complete (%s).

§fStation Hacked
One or more individuals has successfully hacked your Security Station and can bypass its protections.
Reboot the Security Station ASAP!
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.spawnerE:
§fThe Spawner Extractor has finished.
You can now remove the Extractor and/or the Empty Spawner below it.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.thermal_:
§fInsufficient Temperature Differential
§0Place a hot block on any side of the compressor, and a cold block on the opposite side.

§fPoor Temperature Differential
§0Place a hot block on any side of the compressor, and a cold block on the opposite side.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.uv_light:
§fNo Item
§0Insert an item to be exposed.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.problems.vacuum_t:
§fNo Spawner Core
§0Insert a (non-full) Spawner Core to trap mobs in.

§fSpawner Core Full
§0Replace the Spawner Core with a new one with some space for mobs.

§fNot Enough Memory Essence
§0Vacuum Trap will be much more efficient with at least 100mB of Memory Essence in the tank. You can use a Memory Stick or Aerial Interface to extract essence from your experience.

§fVacuum Trap Closed
§0Mobs can only be absorbed when the trap is open. Sneak + Right-Click with an empty hand or apply a redstone signal to toggle it open/closed.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.redstoneBehaviour: High Signal and Space in Inventory
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.tile.gas_lift.dis: The Gas Lift will try to auto-eject liquids into adjacent tanks.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.aerial_i:
Allows interfacing of Food & Experience instead of items. Only food items will be accepted through the Aerial Interface; see the Feed Mode tab opposite for how the food is handled.

If a suitable XP fluid is available, it can be pumped in or out of the Aerial Interface and will convert to or from player levels.  See the Interfacing XP tab opposite to choose which fluid type to use.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.air_cann: Fired items will automatically try to go into inventories they hit. When firing at a Chest for example, items will land in the Chest without needing a Hopper.
Makes the Air Cannon act like a Dispenser: any item that would act specially in a Dispenser, will be handled in a similar way here.

When fired, the Air Cannon will grab the closest living entity (including players!) and shoot it to its set coordinate. It has a grab radius of 1 block by default, increasing by 1 per inserted Entity Tracker Upgrade.
By default the Air Cannon shoots items with a lifespan of 60 seconds. Each Item Life upgrade inserted increases this by 30 seconds.
Increases the cannon's range by about 25 blocks per upgrade, up to 250 blocks.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.air_comp: Increases the compressed air generated per tick, at the expense of fuel efficiency.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.assembly: All assembly machines that are controlled by this Assembly Controller will operate faster.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.charging: Adds a charge pad to the Charging Station, allowing it to (dis)charge any Drones, items, and player inventory items that are directly above the Charging Station.
Increases the rate at which items can be charged or discharged.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.elevator: Allow the elevator to reclaim some of the air used to ascend when the elevator descends. This comes at a cost of slightly slowed descent. More upgrades mean progressively better air reclamation and slower descent (max: 60%% air reclaimed & 40%% slower descent).
The Elevator will ascend & descend faster (but at a higher pressure cost for ascension).
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.fluid_mi: Auto-ejects fluid to a fluid tank in the Dispenser Upgrade's configured direction (or any available direction if none is configured).
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.fluid_ta: The tank will auto-eject fluid in the upgrade's configured direction at a base rate of 25mB/t (can be increased with Speed Upgrades)
Each Speed Upgrade doubles the rate of fluid ejection when a Dispenser Upgrade is installed.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.flux_com: Increases the air production rate. It also increases the FE usage and input rate, but reduces conversion efficiency.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.solar_co: Increases the base air production rate. Also increases the rate heat is generated, but the overheat temperature remains the same.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.gas_lift: Auto-ejects fluid to a fluid tank in the Dispenser Upgrade's configured direction (or any available direction if none is configured).
Increases the speed at which the Gas Lift searches for and pumps fluid blocks.
Adds a built-in safety valve to the machine, automatically releasing some air if the pressure would rise into the danger zone.
Increases the heat capacity of this machine. It will heat up slower, but it also will cool down slower.

Increases the air capacity of the machine by 2 * √U, where U = the number of Volume Upgrades.
Note: Adding Volume Upgrades increases the air that can be stored, causing a pressure drop.  Removing upgrades keeps the pressure constant, losing air from the machine.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.liquid_c: Increases the compressed air generated per tick, at the expense of fuel efficiency.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.liquid_h: Allows the hopper to provide fluids infinitely.
Sucks in any fluid block at the input side of the Hopper, and places down any fluid at the output side. Can be used for example as water pump.
The hopper will attempt to interact with any fluid-carrying entities (drones, some modded minecarts...) at its input or output and transfer fluid to or from those entities as appropriate.
Increases the speed at which the Hopper transfers fluid.  With the maximum number of upgrades, the Liquid Hopper can transfer its entire contents in one tick.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.omnidire: Allows the hopper to provide items infinitely.
Ejects items into the world at the output side (if there's no inventory to take them).
Increases the speed at which the Hopper transfers items. Each upgrade doubles the transfer rate.

The hopper will attempt to interact with any inventory-carrying entities (players, drones, chest minecarts...) at its input or output and transfer items to or from those entities as appropriate.
For players, a horizontal interaction will access the equipment slots (armor & offhand), and a vertical interaction will access the main inventory.
Note: this doesn't apply to absorbing item entities themselves (as a vanilla Hopper does); that doesn't need an Entity Tracker Upgrade.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.pneumati: Increases the player detection range by one block for every upgrade.
Increases the speed at which the door opens/closes.
Increases the RF production and output rate, but reduces conversion efficiency.

Adjusts the output rate:
§00 upgrades --> 32 EU/t
§01 upgrade --> 128 EU/t
§02 upgrades --> 512 EU/t
§03 upgrades --> 2048 EU/t
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.pressure: An Interface in export mode with a Dispenser Upgrade will eject items into the world if there is no inventory to push them into.
The pressure doors of the Interface will open/close faster, meaning items can be transferred in or out more quickly.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.pressuri: The potential spawning area is increased by one block per upgrade, from a minimum of two blocks in each direction. Vertical range is not affected and follows vanilla Spawner rules.
Mobs will be spawned more quickly, but an exponentially-rising air cost.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.programm:
By default the Programmable Controller can carry one stack of items. For every Inventory Upgrade inserted, the Drone can transfer one additional stack.

It will also increase the internal liquid tank by 16000mB per upgrade, and 100000RF storage per upgrade (if installed). It also increases the rate at which the Drone can transfer RF (transfer = max storage / 100).

With one or more Magnet Upgrades inserted, the Programmable Controller's minidrone will automatically pick up nearby items, if the controller has free inventory space. The base range is 2 blocks, increasing by 1 block per inserted upgrade.
Increases the travel speed of the Programmable Controller minidrone.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.security: Each Entity Tracker Upgrade increases the Intrusion Detection Chance (per node captured by the hacker). There are diminishing returns to adding more and more Entity Tracker Upgrades.
Increases the (cubic) range of the Security Station by one block for each upgrade (up to 16 blocks).
Increases the Security Station's rating by one for each upgrade. Players need more Security Upgrades in their Pneumatic Helmet than the Security Station has to be able to even begin a hack attempt.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.sentry_t: Increases the range of the Sentry Turret by one block for each upgrade.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.smart_ch: With a Dispenser Upgrade installed, sides configured to push items will eject them into the world if there's no inventory present on that side.

With a Magnet Upgrade installed, sides configured to pull items will absorb nearby items in the world if there's no inventory present on that side. The default range is a 3x3x3 cube centered 2 blocks from the side in question, but can be increased with Range Upgrades.
Each Range Upgrade increases the Magnet Upgrade's range by one block.
Each Speed Upgrade doubles the item push/pull rate of the Smart Chest.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.thermopn: The Thermopneumatic Processing Plant will try to auto-eject liquids into adjacent tanks.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.universa: A Block Tracker upgrade allows the use of sensor settings which monitor nearby blocks. This will also require a GPS Tool or GPS Area Tool to identify the blocks to be monitored.
A Dispenser upgrade allows the use of sensor settings which monitor miscellaneous world conditions.
An Entity Tracker upgrade allows the use of sensor settings which monitor nearby entities.

Each Range Upgrade increases the area which can be monitored by one block in each direction. Use the 'Show Range' button to view the monitored area in-world.

The base range (with no upgrades) is 8 blocks in each direction.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.uv_light: Completed items will be auto-ejected in the upgrade's configured direction.
The UV lights will glow brighter and expose PCB's more quickly (at a higher air cost).
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.vacuum_p: The Vacuum Pump will produce more vacuum per tick. However this is at the expense of efficiency.
pneumaticcraft.gui.tab.upgrades.vacuum_t: Each installed Range Upgrade increases the range at which entities will be pulled by 1 block, from the base range of 3 blocks.

pneumaticcraft.gui.tubeModule.advancedCo: When this is checked, you can define the behaviour in a more advanced way.
This sensor setting simulates a Redstone Comparator at the position(s) marked by the GPS (Area) Tool, so the output redstone signal is proportional to the contents of inventories at those positions. If the comparator output would be side dependant, the highest signal will be emitted.
In the case of multiple positions, the highest comparator value from any position will be emitted.

The block position(s) marked by the GPS (Area) Tool are monitored for heat. When the temperature of the monitored block is higher than the temperature in the text box (in °C) the sensor will emit a redstone level of 15, and 0 if not.
If the textfield is empty, the output level is proportional to the temperature, scaling from 0°C (redstone=0) through 400°C (redstone=15).
In the case of multiple positions, the position with the highest temperature is used.
Emits an analog redstone signal, equal to the light level at the block position(s) stored in the GPS (Area) Tool. In the case of multiple positions, the position with the highest light value is used.

Emits a redstone signal of level 15 if there's a block (anything except air) at the position(s) marked by the GPS (Area) Tool.
In the case of multiple positions, if any of the positions contain a block, then a redstone signal will be emitted.

This sensor can be used as a wireless redstone device, since it emits the same redstone signal level that's present at the GPS (Area) Tool's marked position(s).
In the case of multiple positions, the position with the highest redstone value is used.

This pseudo-sensor emits a constant redstone value. The value emitted is the numeric value inserted into the textfield.
This sensor costs no air to run.
Emits a redstone pulse when any player attacks any entity within range of the sensor.

This sensor emits an analog redstone signal proportional to the player's health: 0 health = 0 redstone, and full health = 15 redstone.
The name of the player to be monitored must be entered into the textfield.
Emits a 5-tick redstone pulse when any player picks up an item within range of the sensor.
Emits a 5-tick redstone pulse when any player right clicks the block at the position(s) selected by the GPS (Area) Tool, within range of the sensor.
This acts exactly like a vanilla Daylight Detector.

Emits a redstone level for every entity within range. You can select a specific entity by filling in its name in the textfield.
Hold F1 for detailed help on entity filter syntax.
Emits a redstone signal of the strength of the linked global variable's X value (clamped to 0..15)
Emits a redstone signal level 15 when the linked global variable has any non-zero X value
Emits a redstone signal if it's currently raining in this world.

Emits a redstone level for every player logged into the server.
If you enter a specific player name in the textfield, will emit a redstone signal of 15 if the player is online, and 0 otherwise.

Emits a redstone level dependant on the time used by the server to update the world this Universal Sensor is in. This time is calculated in the same way as Forge's /tps command. With the textfield you can select a resolution as follows:
Strength = Ticktime (ms) * TextboxValue
Example: Ticktime = 20mS ; Textfield text = '0.5'
Strength = 20 * 0.5 = 10

Emits a redstone signal of which the strength is proportional to the day time of the world (0..23999):
strength = time / 1500
Example: If the time is 6000 (noon), the redstone strength will be 4.
Emits a redstone signal when the name of the streamer in the textfield is streaming at this moment.

Emits a redstone signal based on how soon it will rain.
strength = 15 - time till rain (min)
E.g. if it will rain in 10 minutes, then strength = 5.
